intro: Lepidium tenellum, commonly known as field pennycress, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring smooth, glabrous stems and alternate, pinnately lobed leaves. Its small yellow flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom in the summer months. The plant produces small, round seeds that are often used in herbal remedies and as a source of oil.
